Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can identify and draw different habitats, such as a forest, pond, or garden, with clear distinctions between them.
The student can draw and accurately label a variety of plants in each habitat, such as trees and grasses in a forest, or flowering plants in a garden.
The student can draw and label a range of animals commonly found in each habitat, like squirrels in a forest or fish in a pond.
The student can demonstrate understanding of diversity by including different types of plants and animals in each habitat.
The student can show patterns by including both similar and different plants and animals across different habitats, like trees in both forests and gardens.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally forget to label some elements in the drawing or make slight inaccuracies in species names (e.g., mixing up similar animal species).
The student may not fully capture the subtle variations within a specific habitat (e.g., specific undergrowth types in a forest).
